notesStmt.note: Folio 135: a torn piece of paper pasted on a folio, irregularly written, with an admonition regarding settlement of property.Folio 136: a piece of paper pasted on folio, with a short quotation from Ḥayim Vital.Folios 138-139: contain part 2, chapters 19 to 29, of More nevukhim, in Shemu᾿el Ibn Tibbon's translation (originally part of a different manuscript, parchment, written in Sefardi semi-cursive of the 15th century). See more parts of this manuscript under Add MS 27010, 827.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 39: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, folio [140v] (fse001v).
